pros: The PEBA health insurance was pretty good. I also enjoyed getting to know some of my coworkers.
cons: When I first started at New Horizon, I had high expectations due to my wonderful experiences at other health centers. I was let down immensely. Turnover across the organization (PSRs, nurses, finance/billing staff, custodians, providers, administrators, etc.) is extremely high and it seems like management, for the most part, does not care. The CEO could not be bothered to interact with staff, not even with a simple email or a brief appearance on the orientation video in which other executive leadership members appear. Have a new, innovative idea on how something should be done? Unfortunately new ideas are not welcomed in this highly traditional organization with its antiquated way of doing things. Want to change your hours slightly to make your work/life balance more even? Likely not going to happen, even though they love to say that employees have a great work/life balance. I have never felt like more of a cog in a machine than I have at New Horizon. I hope I can help at least one person steer clear of this organization. No position is exempt from the low morale that plagues New Horizon, which I have found out through various conversations with employees. Unfortunately I cannot see this changing anytime soon unless they decide to hire a new executive staff and replace some of the other managerial positions. Until they decide to do that, you need to find an organization that actually values its employees.

To whomever reads this post.......do not apply for work within this organization unless you’re absolutely and I mean absolutely desperate for employment! Make New Horizon your last resort!!! They will try to discredit you as an employee/person and even lie on you so that they will have an excuse to get rid of you or force you to resign. There’s a huge lack in leadership throughout the organization, lack of team-work, and communication is the worst that I have ever seen!!! The employees’ are afraid to voice their opinions/speak up for what is right due to the fear of losing their jobs because of the dishonesty and distrust of those in administration/leadership. Everyone is so busy working against each other instead of working together-and it’s very sad because the patients should be the top priority.
